decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly assemble the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo for a quick win while protecting itself with countermagic and card draw. The deck relies on generating large amounts of mana with fast mana sources like Moxen and Mana Crypt to cast powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome, Tinker, and Ancestral Recall. It also utilizes card selection and manipulation tools like Sensei's Divining Top, Brainstorm, and Preordain to find key pieces and maintain consistency. The deck can win in a single turn, making it a formidable force in Vintage 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on fast mana acceleration using Mishra's Workshop and Sol lands to deploy disruptive artifacts such as Sphere of Resistance, Chalice of the Void, and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent. It also aims to control the board with creatures like Phyrexian Revoker and Steel Overseer while generating value from cards like Arcbound Ravager and Hangarback Walker. The deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption, making it difficult for them to stabilize and counter the MUD player's threats.

The deck focuses on locking down opponent's resources and disrupting their plays while steadily deploying a swarm of artifact creatures to overwhelm them. By using powerful mana acceleration from Mishra's Workshop and Tolarian Academy, the deck aims to play multiple threats in quick succession, supported by cards like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent. With a mix of synergy between artifact creatures like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to win through combat damage or by sacrificing artifacts for extra value.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures while also disrupting their resources with land destruction and taxing effects. By using powerful mana accelerants like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, the deck can quickly deploy threats like Walking Ballista and Steel Overseer. The inclusion of disruptive artifacts like Thorn of Amethyst and Sphere of Resistance further hinders the opponent's ability to play spells effectively. The deck aims to deploy a quick and efficient board presence to close out the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The deck revolves around milling cards from your library to fill up the graveyard with creatures, allowing you to bring them back onto the battlefield with cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below. The key strategy is to quickly amass a large number of creatures in the graveyard, then use cards like Cabal Therapy to disrupt your opponent's game plan while overwhelming them with an aggressive board presence. The deck focuses on using powerful graveyard synergies to create explosive turns and overwhelming your opponent with an army of undead creatures.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful artifact creatures and mana acceleration from Mishra's Workshop and Moxen. The key concept revolves around locking down the opponent's resources with Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void, while also building a strong board presence with creatures like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager. The goal is to quickly establish a dominant board position and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a swift victory through efficient aggression and resource denial.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with early aggression and disruption using powerful artifact creatures and mana acceleration. By deploying threats like Steel Overseer, Walking Ballista, and Arcbound Ravager quickly, backed up by cards like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void to slow down the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to take control of the game early and maintain its advantage with efficient mana sources and disruptive elements.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana through artifact acceleration and cards like Tolarian Academy, allowing the player to cast Paradoxical Outcome to draw a significant number of cards and replay their artifacts for even more mana. The deck utilizes key artifacts like Time Vault and Voltaic Key to take extra turns and win the game quickly. It also includes disruption like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect the combo and control the game until the player can assemble their win condition.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells like Force of Will and card draw spells like Ancestral Recall. The key strategy revolves around using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Inferno Titan early in the game. The deck includes a mix of powerful Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Dack Fayden to provide additional card advantage and disruption. With a strong mana base and access to powerful spells like Time Walk and Demonic Tutor, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in Vintage 1 vs 1 matchups.

The deck focuses on the strategy of using fast mana and card draw to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards quickly. It aims to assemble the Time Vault and Voltaic Key combo for an infinite turn loop or generate enough storm count for a lethal Tendrils of Agony finish. The deck utilizes powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk along with mana acceleration from Moxen and Tolarian Academy to quickly combo off and win the game in a single turn. It also includes disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Mental Misstep to protect the combo.

The deck focuses on assembling a board presence of artifact creatures quickly, using mana acceleration from lands and mana rocks. It uses disruptive cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst to slow down the opponent while overwhelming them with aggressive creatures like Walking Ballista and Steel Overseer. The deck also includes a variety of utility artifacts like Phyrexian Revoker and Hangarback Walker for flexibility in different matchups. The goal is to establish a dominant board presence and outpace the opponent's resources to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells like Force of Will and Pyroblast, along with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Lightning Bolt. It also utilizes card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Dig Through Time, while generating value with Young Pyromancer and Monastery Mentor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, protect its threats, and outvalue the opponent to ultimately gain control of the game and win through card advantage and powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays and mana denial, utilizing cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's resources. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Young Pyromancer, Delver of Secrets, and Snapcaster Mage while countering opposing spells with cards like Spell Pierce, Mental Misstep, and Force of Will. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Preordain to maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck's strategy is to apply pressure early on and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The primary strategy of this deck revolves around using Oath of Druids to get a powerful creature like Griselbrand onto the battlefield quickly. The deck includes a variety of powerful card draw, counterspells, and tutors to control the game and find key pieces like Oath of Druids or combo pieces like Time Vault and Voltaic Key. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with big creatures or a Time Vault combo.

This deck utilizes the power of artifacts and card draw to quickly assemble and execute a game-winning combo involving Time Vault and Voltaic Key. It carefully balances fast mana acceleration with disruptive control elements, allowing the player to efficiently dig through their deck, generate mana, and protect their combo from disruption. By effectively managing resources and making optimal sequencing decisions, the deck can consistently find the pieces it needs to execute its game plan and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of this deck is to use the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard with creatures, then utilize cards like Dread Return and Bridge from Below to bring back powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Flame-Kin Zealot for explosive combos. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Mental Misstep and Force of Will to protect its strategy. Mana Confluence, City of Brass, and Bazaar of Baghdad help fix mana and enable the graveyard shenanigans. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a quick and overwhelming onslaught of reanimated creatures.
